concepts.description: Text extracted from echocardiography reports using regular expressions.
Whether the patient has restrictions on life saving resuscitation.
Comorbidities in categories proposed by Elixhauser et al. AHRQ produced the mapping.
Comorbidities in categories proposed by Elixhauser et al. where DRG codes are not used to exclude primary conditions.
Comorbidities in categories proposed by Elixhauser et al. using an algorithm by Quan et al.
An integer score relating comorbid burden to mortality (AHRQ comorbidities).
An integer score relating comorbid burden to mortality (Quan et al. comorbidities).
Patient height (cm) and weight (kg).
Information relating to each patient ICU stay.
A table with one row per hour a patient is in the ICU.
A table with start/stop times for a patient's ICU stay based on the time of their first and last documented heart rate.
Load ICD-9 to CCS mapping.
Start and stop times for administration of adenosine.
Start and stop times for presence of an arterial line.
Start and stop times for presence of an central line
Start and stop times for continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT).
Start and stop times for administration of dobutamine.
Start and stop times for administration of dopamine.
Start and stop times for administration of epinephrine.
Start and stop times for administration of isuprel.
Start and stop times for administration of milrinone.
Start and stop times for administration of norepinephrine.
Start and stop times for administration of phenylephrine.
Start and stop times for administration of vasopressin.
Start and stop times for administration of vasopressor.
Dose administered with start/stop times for dobutamine.
Dose administered with start/stop times for dopamine.
Dose administered with start/stop times for epinephrine.
Dose administered with start/stop times for neuro blocking agents.
Dose administered with start/stop times for norepinephrine.
Dose administered with start/stop times for phenylephrine.
Dose administered with start/stop times for vasopressin.
Classifies patient settings as implying mechanical ventilation.
Start and stop times for mechanical ventilation.
Start and stop times for daily weight measurements.
Highest and lowest blood gas values in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Highest and lowest arterial blood gas values in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Highest and lowest Glasgow Coma Scale in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Median height recorded for the patient in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Highest and lowest laboratory values in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Presence of renal replacement therapy in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Total urine output over the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Whether the patient was mechanically ventilated in the first 24 hours.
Highest and lowest vital signs in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Highest and lowest weight measurements in the first 24 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Times at which a patient received a bolus of colloidal fluid.
Times at which a patient received a bolus of crystalloid fluid.
Urine output for a patient with the time of documentation.
Creatinine values with baseline creatinine as defined by KDIGO.
Urine output over 6, 12, and 24 hour periods.
Stages of acute kidney failure (AKI) as defined by KDIGO.
Stages of AKI for the first 48 hours of a patient's ICU stay.
Stages of AKI for the first 7 days of a patient's ICU stay.
The MELD score, often used to assess health of liver transplant candidates.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and blood gas measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and fraction of inspired oxygen measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and Glasgow Coma Scale measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and height measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and intracranial pressure measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and invasive lines data. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and laboratory values. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and the Oxford Acute Severity of Illness Score (OASIS). They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and renal replacement therapy data. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and the Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) scale. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and urine output measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Pivoted views contain the patient icustay_id, the charttime, and vital sign measurements. They are useful for acquiring a time series of values for patient stays.
Sepsis defined using billing codes validated by Angus et al.
Explicitly coded sepsis (i.e. a list of patients with ICD-9 codes which refer to sepsis).
Sepsis defined using billing codes validated by Martin et al. (now considered "septicemia").
Severity of illness score: Acute Physiology Score III. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: Logistic Organ Dysfunction Score. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: Modified Logistic Organ Dysfunction Score. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: The Oxford Acute Severity of Illness Score (OASIS). Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: The quick Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (qSOFA) scale. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: The Simplified Acute Physiology Score (SAPS). Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: SAPS II. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: The Systemic Inflammation Response Score (SIRS). Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
Severity of illness score: The Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) scale. Defined using the highest/lowest values during the first 24 hours of a patient's stay.
A list of antibiotics mentioned in the prescriptions table.
Suspicion of infection as defined by antibiotic use near the ordering of blood cultures.
Count the number of hospital admissions in equally sized bins of age
Retrieves basic patient information from the patients table
Create a distribution of BUN values for adult hospital admissions
Find the glasgow coma *MOTOR* score for each adult patient
Retrieves a glucose histogram of adult patients
Create a histogram bicarbonate levels for all patients (adults and neonates)
Create a histogram of heart rates for adult patients
Create a histogram of heights for all patients
Count the number of patients with a specific icd9 code above a certain age
Count the number of patients with a specific icd9 code
Count the number of patients with a specific icd9 code and shows the output as a histogram with groups of age
Count the number of patients with two specific icd9 codes above a certain age
Count the number of patients with two specific icd9 codes
Create a table that counts each day spent in the ICU and assign a timestamp to the start and end of each day
Retrieves the systolic blood pressure of hospital survivors
Calculate in-hospital, 30-day, and 1 year mortality (from hospital admission)
Counts the total number of patients
Creates a histogram of serum potassium for adult patients
Retrieves the respiration rate of adult patients
Retrieves the systolic blood pressure for adult patients
Retrieves the blood serum sodium levels for adult patients
Retrieves the temperature of adult patients
Retrieves the urine output of adult patients
Retrieves the white blood cell count for adult patients
